byline.original: By MARC SANTORA and BENJAMIN WEISER

abstract: Federal prosecutors decline to pursue criminal charges against New York City Police Officer Richard Haste, who shot and killed 18-year-old Ramarley Graham in his Bronx home in 2012; Graham's death preceded series of high-profile cases focused on killing of black people by law enforcement; city has agreed to pay $3.9 million to settle wrongful death suit.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Graham’s family had hoped that prosecutors would bring a civil rights case against the officer who killed the unarmed teenager in the bathroom of his family’s Bronx home in 2012.

headline.main: Officer in Ramarley Graham Shooting Won’t Face U.S. Charges
headline.print_headline: Officer in Teenager’s Shooting Won’t Face Federal Charges

snippet: Mr. Graham’s family had hoped that prosecutors would bring a civil rights case against the officer who killed the unarmed teenager in the bathroom of his family’s Bronx home in 2012.
